item.description:
Join me at Pecha Kucha! What's that? Just keep reading all the way to the bottom. If you haven't been yet, this one will be worth checking out - just look at the lineup!!! The theme is "Sugar", so really, what's not to like!?

The Providence Pecha Kucha is the longest running consecutive Pecha Kucha in the world! Yes, it's really true!

Details: Announcing the 43rd Pecha Kucha Night in Providence! This month it will be in the new SPOT PROVIDENCE (opening on the 10/9/2012 at 101 Richmond Street - 2nd Floor - PVD)!!!!

As always, admission is FREE!!!

This month the theme is.... "sugar"
Some of the presenters will include:

- Wendy Nilsson
- Ana Simoes LeGoff
- Scott Indermaur
- Michaela Foulkes
- John Taraborelli and Christine Malecki West
- Mayor Angel Taveras

just to name a few....

If you need additional information or wish to present at a future PechaKucha Night, email us at providencepkn@gmail.com!

Hope to see you on the 24th!!!

If you haven't heard of this global yet unpronounceable phenomenon, Pecha Kucha is a monthly format for sharing ideas, in which presenters are allotted 20 slides and 20 seconds per slide. Put simply: 6 minutes and 40 seconds of adult-style show & tell. It began in Tokyo in 2003, has since spread to over 463 cities worldwide, and first landed in Providence in March of 09.

***Doors open at 7:20, presentations start at 8:20, and schmoozing goes down throughout.***
item.how_to_find_us: This is posted as an FYI - I will probably be going wearing some kind of scarf. Look for me.
item.name: P-Collective FYI - Pecha Kucha #43 at the Spot Underground!!!!
